content.description: Climb the obvious seam, formed by a flake, with crux moves right off the ground.  You can make it easier by stemming to the rock behind. At the top of the seam, head slightly right and then straight up to the anchor on juggy holds.
content.protection: Top rope only from a three bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: This is the seam to the left of, and a little above, East Pillar Center.

content.description: Start this one below a large block on the northeast corner of the rock.  Vertical rock with jugs leads to a lower angle section below a roof.  Pass the roof on the left and head up a juggy, vertical wall to the anchor.
content.protection: Top rope only from a three bolt anchor.  This is the only set of bolts on the rock equipped with chains.
content.location: This is the furthest right of three lines that can be top roped from the bolts located furthest to the east.  It is on the northeast corner of the rock.

content.description: Start on top of the block above and to the left of East Pillar Right.  Pull straight up the steep wall heading directly for the anchor.  There are many good holds but they are hard to find and it can be "pumpy" trying to figure out which holds to use.
content.protection: Top rope only from a three bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the line just to the left of East Pillar Right. It uses the same top rope anchor.
